publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2508 Fiona McLeod: GM Cross Contamination—That the Parliament recognises the Mexican Government’s ban on all genetically modified material; is distressed that cross-contamination from GM crops banned eight years ago is having a direct effect on current crops; believes that the only answer is a moratorium on GM field trials, and calls on the Scottish Executive to reverse its decision to carry out field trials at Munlochy and other sites in Scotland. Supported by: Bruce Crawford*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Mr Andrew Welsh*, Tommy Sheridan*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Michael Russell*

S1M-2508 Fiona McLeod: GM Cross Contamination-That the Parliament recognises the Mexican Government's ban on all genetically modified material; is distressed that cross-contamination from GM crops banned eight years ago is having a direct effect on current crops; believes that the only answer is a moratorium on GM field trials, and calls on the Scottish Executive to reverse its decision to carry out field trials at Munlochy and other sites in Scotland. Supported by: Bruce Crawford, Mr Andrew Welsh, Tommy Sheridan, Michael Matheson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Gil Paterson, Michael Russell
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) John Farquhar Munro*, Christine Grahame*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Alex Neil*, Linda Fabiani*, Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Brian Adam*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Irene McGugan*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Fiona Hyslop*, Colin Campbell*
S1M-2508 GM Cross Contamination (lodged on 3 December 2001) Mr Kenny MacAskill*
